required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of COVID-19 Lockdown in Exercising Early Postmenopausal Women
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Three Months of COVID-19 Lockdown Induced Deconditioning After 13 Months of High Intensity Exercise Training in Early Postmenopausal Women

brief_summary.textblock: While "conditioning" by exercise training has been widely evaluated, the available literature on "passive deconditioning" (i.e. forced deconditioning) is predominately limited to studies with or with almost complete mechanical and/or metabolic immobilization/sedation of the respective functional system (e.g. paralysis, bedriddenness). Vice versa, the effects of moderately long interruptions of dedicated types of exercise while maintaining everyday activity are rarely addressed. However, this topic is of high relevance, e.g. considering that breaks of health-related exercise programs due to increased family/occupational stress, vacation or temporary orthopedic limitation are rather frequent in everyday life. In the present project we aimed to determine the effects of 3 months of physical deconditioning due to COVID-19 induced lockdown after 13 month of high intensity endurance and resistance exercise in early postmenopausal women on parameters related to health and physical fitness.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: One exercise versus one control group
study_design_info.masking_description: Outcomes assessors are unaware of participants group status and were not allowed to ask correspondingly

primary_outcome.time_frame: From intervention end to 3 months FU
primary_outcome.description: Body composition as determined by Dual-Energy x-Ray Absorptiometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From intervention end to 3 months FU
secondary_outcome.description: Hip-/Leg extension strength as determined by an isokinetic leg press

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From intervention end to 3 months FU
secondary_outcome.description: cardio-metabolic risk factors summarized in the Metabolic Syndrome Z-Score according to the definition of the International Diabetes Federation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From intervention end to 3 months FU
secondary_outcome.description: BMD at the lumbar spine and total hip as determined by Dual Energy x-Ray Absorptiometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From intervention end to 3 months FU
secondary_outcome.description: Menopausal symptoms as determined by the "Menopausal Rating Scale" (MRS) with a scale from 0 (no complaints) to 4 (very serious complaints).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From intervention end to 3 months FU
secondary_outcome.description: Back and joint pain as determined by a standardized pain questionnaire with a scale from 0 (never) to 7 (permanent) for pain frequency or 0 (no pain) to 7 (extremely) for pain severity.

arm_group.description: 13 months of high intensity endurance and resistance exercise - 3 months of exercise break
no exercise intervention that affect the present study outcomes

intervention.description: 13 months of high intensity endurance and resistance exercise, 3x 45 min/week - 3 months of COVID-19 induced exercise break
Types of exercise (flexibility, relaxation) that did not affect the present outcomes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- (early)postmenopausal women, ( normal menopause, 1-5 years post)
- Osteopenia and osteoporosis (Bone Mineral Density <-1.0 SD T-Score)
Exclusion Criteria:
- BMD <-4.0 SD T-Score
- Prevalent clinical, low-trauma fractures
- Diseases and drugs with relevant effects on bone and muscle metabolism (e.g. glucocorticoids >7.5 mg/d or bisphosphonate therapy); individual case assessment
- Diseases and drugs with relevant effects on cardiometabolic risk factors (e.g. severe hypertension with corresponding medical therapy); individual case assessment
- Severe cardiovascular events (e.g. stroke, coronary infarction) in the past.
- Other conditions, diseases that exclude exercise training or testing
